column2: NORTH CAROLINA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: North Carolina
column6: NC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Stop
column6: Road narrows ahead
column8: Slow down or stop
column10: Stop if necessary

column2: 3. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should stop walking immediately.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 4. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 5. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter
column6: yield
column8: wrong Way
column10: stop

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a low place in the road.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 7. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers must turn right
column6: No right turn permitted
column8: Right turn permitted on red light
column10: No U-turns

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No right turn
column8: Narrow Bridge
column10: Steep downgrade

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: Shopping centre ahead.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 12. This is:
column4: a side road sign.
column6: a right curve sign.
column8: a reduction of lanes sign.
column10: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 13. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: pedestrians only.
column6: vehicles from the left.
column8: vehicles from both directions.
column10: vehicles from the right.

column2: 14. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 15. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column10: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 16. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: maintain a constant speed.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 17. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The driver on the right.
column8: The driver on the left.
column10: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 18. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: You have the right-of-way.

column2: 19. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Call an ambulance.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column10: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 20. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: On slippery roads.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 21. To enter a freeway:
column4: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column6: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 22. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: both
column6: whoever is slower
column8: the pedestrian
column10: the driver

column2: 23. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Rely on your mirrors.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 24. BAC is:
column4: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
column6: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 25. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: darker
column6: narrower and shorter
column8: larger and deeper
column10: less dangerous

column2: 26. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: switch to daytime lights.

column2: 27. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 28. Aggressive drivers:
column4: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.
column6: are high risk drivers.
column8: run stop signs.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 29. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column6: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column8: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column10: slow down before entering the exit ramp.

column2: 30. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column10: Drive with caution.

column2: 31. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column6: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column8: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column10: go through as soon as the first train passes.

column2: 32. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: pump your brakes.
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column10: brake suddenly carefully.

column2: 33. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 34. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in the direction you want to go.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: to keep the front wheels straight.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 35. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column6: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 36. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 37. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Shift to a lower gear.
column6: Brake lightly.
column8: Use your ABS System.
column10: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
